dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3775 IH: AI Training Extension Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Mace (for herself and Ms. Brown) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend the Artificial Intelligence Training for the Acquisition Workforce Act to expand AI training within the executive branch of the Federal Government, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the AI Training Extension Act of 2025.

section.header: Expansion of AI training within the executive branch of the Federal Government

subsection.text: Section 2 of the Artificial Intelligence Training for the Acquisition Workforce Act (Public Law 117–207; 41 U.S.C. 1703 note) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraph (4);
by redesignating paragraphs (1), (2), (3), and (5), as (3), (4), (5), and (7), respectively;
by inserting before paragraph (3), as so redesignated, the following:

paragraph.text: The term acquisition position means any position listed in subsection (g)(1)(A) of section 1703 of title 41, United States Code.
The term Administrator means the Administrator of General Services.

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (5), as so redesignated—

clause.text: by redesignating subparagraph (B) as subparagraph (E); and
inserting before subparagraph (E), as so redesignated, the following:

subparagraph.text: an employee of an executive agency serving in an acquisition position;
a management official;
a supervisor;
an employee serving in a data or technology position; and
by inserting before paragraph (7), as so redesignated, the following:

paragraph.text: The term data or technology position means a position that is classified to an occupational series within the Mathematical Sciences Group or to the Information Technology Group identified by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management.

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The term management official has the meaning given the term in section 7103(a) of title 5, United States Code.
The term supervisor has the meaning given the term in section 7103(a) of title 5, United States Code.

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)—

clause.text: by striking (1) In general.—Not and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: Not

clause.text: by striking the Director, in coordination with the Administrator of General Services and any other person determined relevant by the Director and inserting the Administrator, in coordination with the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and any other person determined relevant by the Administrator; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: For the purposes of subparagraph (A), the Administrator may incorporate the AI training program described under subparagraph (A) into any other training program that the Administrator determines relevant to providing the information required under paragraph (3), including training programs offered under section 4103 of title 5, United States Code.
in paragraph (2), by striking knowledge and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting the following:
the capabilities and risks associated with AI; and

requirements and best practices established by the Administrator with respect to AI and in accordance with the guidance established by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget under section 104 of the AI in Government Act of 2020 (Public Law 116–260; 40 U.S.C. 11301 note) and section 7224 and 7225 of the Advancing American AI Act (subtitle B of title LXXII of Public Law 117–263; 40 U.S.C. 11301 note) as applicable.
in paragraph (3)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking the science underlying AI, including and inserting what AI is and;
in subparagraph (B), by striking artificial intelligence systems and inserting AI;
by amending subparagraph (C) to read as follows: the potential benefits posed by AI, including such potential benefits to the Federal Government;;
in subparagraph (D), by inserting and the risks posed to the Federal Government after privacy;
in subparagraph (E), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
by amending subparagraph (F) to read as follows: what executive agencies should consider with respect to development, deployment, and management of AI by executive agencies; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: the role of data in developing and operating AI.
in paragraph (4)—

clause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking Director and inserting Administrator;
in subparagraph (A), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in subparagraph (B), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: incorporate, as practicable, any feedback from participants received under paragraph (6).
in paragraph (5), by striking Director and inserting Administrator; and
in paragraph (6)—

clause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking Director shall ensure the existence of and insert Administrator shall establish; and
in subparagraph (B), by inserting through any update to such program under paragraph (4) before the period at the end.

subsection.header: Amendment to short title of artificial intelligence training for the acquisition workforce act

paragraph.text: Section 1 of the Artificial Intelligence Training for the Acquisition Workforce Act (Public Law 117–207; 41 U.S.C. 1703 note) is amended by striking for the Acquisition Workforce.

Any reference in law, regulation, document, paper, or other record to the Artificial Intelligence Training for the Acquisition Workforce Act shall be construed as referring to the Artificial Intelligence Training Act.
